Comment: Maybe not exactly the same thing, but I think my anecdote is related.  When I first joined the military in 2005 it was obvious that not everyone liked W. But for the most part people kept it professional and really didn't talk politics unless it was with people they knew wanted to have a civil discussion and it was over specific issues.  In 2012 I went to shore duty.  The shift was noticeable.  People could say W was a war ciminal, McCain was a terrorist, anything you wanted to about conservative politicians.  But if you said anything bad about Obama, even valid criticisms of his drone or Gitmo policies, you were accused of being unprofessional.    Bottom line, we need to get back to what Saquon is doing here.  Respect the office and pray for our leaders success.  Because when they succeed, America succeeds.
